properties.title: Exeter, Fore st between broadgate and Milk Lane
properties.description: 55 Alexandrian coins among approx 1110 reported coins altogether, including 9 Ptolemaic, 35 Syrian., 11 Byzantine.

properties.title: Exeter, St George's Church
properties.description: 1 Ptolemaic, 5(?) Alexandrian (Trajan 1, Diocletian Y3, Aurelian, Claudius II 269AD, 2 x Philip I Y3 & Y6?), 3 Syrian, 2 Byzantine

properties.title: Poltimore
properties.description: 3 Ptolemaic, 4 (2?) Alexandrian (1 Hadrian, 1 Antoninus Pius; 1 Trajan, 1 Hadrian), 10 Syrian, 3 Byzantine.

properties.title: Gourock Bay
properties.source: Kell, An Account of a discovery of Roman Building in Gurnard Bay (1866), JBAA. Pp.358-361
properties.description: A mixture of copper coins found at the shore line, near a late Roman building in Gurdnard Bay. Listed are: (1) Agathocles, Greek. (1) Ptolemy 8th or 9th. Egyptian. (1) Another Ptolemy. Ditto; (1) A coin of Corinth or Syracuse. Obv., the head of Venus; rev., a flying horse. (1) A Greek coin. Obv., head of Mars; rev., an cagle. (1) A Greek coin bearing a female head. (1) A Greek coin. Obv., J UP] tel'; ?"ev., warrior with a shield. (1) A Greek coin, probably Macedonian. Obv., a female head; ?'ev., Jupiter seated. (3) A Byzantine coin and two others, probably Greek. (1) A Greek colonial coin. Obv., head of Antoninus Pius; rev., a wreath anclletters s.c; Also a (1) coin of ConstantIne, (1) an Urbs Roma, and (1) a Caligula.

properties.title: Acton Scott
properties.description: 5 Greek coins from Neapolis, Smyrna, Andros and Egypt, found during exacavation of Roman villa at Acton Scott Hall

properties.title: Furzey cliff
properties.description: A grave found between 1835 and 1845, thought to have been uncovered by the landslips at Furzey Cliff, contained a skeleton with a gold finger ring, a model bronze battle-axe and a silver coin of Ptolemy, c 285 BC.

properties.title: Burneside, Kendal
properties.source: Cumberland and Westmorland Antiquarian and Archaeological Society Transactions VOL 96 (1996). PP. 28
properties.description: hoard of 222 Ptolemaic coins (194 Ptolemy VI, 1 Ptolemy V) + 2 Alexandrian tetradrachms + 1 Alexandrian Byzantine coin (12-nummi)

properties.title: Northampton
properties.rulerName: Ptolemaic and Constantinian coins found about 1910

properties.title: Tucton Farm, Dorset
properties.description: A Greek bronze coin of Ptolemy VIII (170-117 BC) was found at Tucton Farm (Moser Estate) when trenching for waterpipes on January 5th 1912. Obverse: Head of Cleopatra as Isis. Reverse: Eagle & inscription. Date: circa 146 - 127 BC. It is in the Red House Museum, Christchurch.

properties.title: Chesham (Roman villa)
properties.source: The Rochester Naturalist, vol. 6, 1924, no.130, p.54.
properties.description: Roman villa site. Unclear if this relates to record in Milne 1948

properties.title: Snodland
properties.source: The Rochester Naturalist, vol. 6, 1924, no.130, p.54.
properties.description: dug up in a clay pit at Mark Farm, Snodland [farm is situated directly on Pilgrim's way near Paddlesworth chapel]

properties.title: Lancashire
properties.source: The Rochester Naturalist, vol. 6, 1924, no.130, p.54.
properties.description: Found in surface soil near a colliery in making a new road in Lancashire

properties.title: Medstead, nr. Alton, Hants
properties.source: The Rochester Naturalist, vol. 6, 1924, no.130, p.54.
properties.description: Found about 2 ft. down, in undisturbed ground

properties.title: Eastbourne
properties.source: The Rochester Naturalist, vol. 6, 1924, no.130, p.54.
properties.description: Found on roman road near Eastbourne

properties.title: Brighton
properties.source: The Rochester Naturalist, vol. 6, 1924, no.130, p.54.
properties.description: Found at extreme east end of Brightonmore than 5ft down, on makin a new road

properties.title: Pevensey
properties.source: The Rochester Naturalist, vol. 6, 1924, no.130, p.54.

properties.title: Caerwent
properties.description: 2 drachms of Ptolemy I (323-283) Reverse: ◊ˇTO◊_EMAIO◊æ BA◊?I◊_E◊∏◊? Eagle Reference: Uncertain. From Six thousand seven hundred and forty-three coins from Caerwent up to 1923 (with a 1927 addenda). These include all coins from Ashby and Hudd's excavations at Caerwent from 1899 to 1913 as well as coins apparently from Caerwent held in museum collections in Newport and Cardiff. Hill (1924) implies additional coins of Ptolemy II also found.

properties.title: Burnham Overy
properties.description: Ptolemaic coin found eighteen inches down at Burnham Overy (name: TF 844 429); hammered out and destroyed before 1933. Two Ptolemaic bronze coins from Burnham Overy listed by Milne (1948)

properties.title: Burnham
properties.description: Other Ptolemaic and also Ro coins from eastern mints found in the Burnham (centred: TF 839427). In possession of the late E N Mennell 1934

properties.title: Winchester, Between Alresford and Guildford Roads
Chesham
properties.description: unclear if this relates to on eo fthe two recorded in Hill, 1924

properties.title: Ballyragget, Co. Kilkenny
properties.source:
Roman Material in Ireland
 Seán P. Ó Ríordáin. Proceedings of the Royal Irish Academy: Archaeology, Culture, History, Literature. Vol. 51 (1945 - 1948), pp. 35-82 (54 pages). P.77
properties.description: silver coin

properties.title: Castlerock, Co. Londonderry
properties.source:
Roman Material in Ireland
 Seán P. Ó Ríordáin. Proceedings of the Royal Irish Academy: Archaeology, Culture, History, Literature. Vol. 51 (1945 - 1948), pp. 35-82 (54 pages). P.77
properties.description: Found under the turf of the golf course

properties.title: Near Limerick
properties.source:
Roman Material in Ireland
 Seán P. Ó Ríordáin. Proceedings of the Royal Irish Academy: Archaeology, Culture, History, Literature. Vol. 51 (1945 - 1948), pp. 35-82 (54 pages). P.77
properties.description: "said to have been found near Limerick

properties.title: Chelmsford, Essex
properties.description: Coin of Ptolemy found 1949 at a depth of 4ft whilst digging a trench. Siting accepted. The area is now under modern roadside verge

properties.title: Chartham park
properties.description: Bronze coin of Ptolemy IV, Philopator, 220-204 BC. found in the kitchen garden of Chartham Park during cultivation digging. The find-spot was in a remote corner, by the garage. Identified by the British Museum. Margary suggests that it may have been thrown out as a curio during the military occupation of the house during the 1939-45 war (1) but Miss. Dance refers to two other Ptlomaic coins, one identical to the Lingfield find, from Compton parish (SU 975 478) in 1960 and a smaller example from Shere (TQ 071 479) in 1957 and suggests that they were genuine evidence of trade contact in antiquity.

properties.title: Bowcombe
properties.description:
AE of Ptolemy found in Bowcombe Valley by G.A.Sherwin. In Carisbrooke Museum.(1) 
 
 Not seen in the Museum. No further information (2)

properties.title: Carbeile
properties.description: A coin of Ptolemy IV (BC 221 - 205) found in ploughing Mr. Reynold's farm, Carbeile (SX 4355). Presented to Plymouth Museum.

properties.title: Three Cocks
properties.description: A Uncertain of Ptolemy II (285-246) Reverse: Eagle Reference: Uncertain. A single coin found 'two feet underground' near Gwernyfed Park in about 1954.

properties.title: Filbert Cottage, Shere
properties.description: Bronze coin of Ptolemy IV found by C.King at a depth of 2-3 ft. in his garden at Filbert Cottage, Lower Street, Shere in=1957. In finder's possession. Mr. King indicated the findspot at TQ 0718547771.

properties.title: Rhayader
properties.description: A Uncertain of Ptolemy II (285-246) Reverse: Eagle Reference: Uncertain. A single coin found in 'a rubbish dump before 1960' in the Elan Valley near Rhayader.

properties.title: Compton Parish
properties.description: Bronze coin of Ptolemy IV, Philopator, 220-204 BC. found in the kitchen garden of Chartham Park during cultivation digging. The find-spot was in a remote corner, by the garage. Identified by the British Museum. Margary suggests that it may have been thrown out as a curio during the military occupation of the house during the 1939-45 war (1) but Miss. Dance refers to two other Ptlomaic coins, one identical to the Lingfield find, from Compton parish (SU 975 478) in 1960 and a smaller example from Shere (TQ 071 479) in 1957 and suggests that they were genuine evidence of trade contact in antiquity.

properties.title: Truro, Highertown
properties.description: presented to Royal Institution of Cornwall. Dug up in farm garden

properties.title: Redhill
properties.description: bronze coin of Ptolemy III

properties.title: Horsham, West Sussex
properties.description: Roman coin of Ptolemy II found laying foundations for Rookeries in 1968.

properties.title: Westhill
properties.description: Found on West Hill (SY 0793) near Aylesbeare Common.

properties.title: Glenboig, Marnoch Drive
properties.source: Roman coins found in Scotland, 1971-1982', Proc Soc Antiq Scot, vol. 113, 1983. Page(s): 413

properties.title: Cliffe and Cliffe Woods
properties.description: Copper alloy Iron Age coin: Greek coin of Ptolemy II Philadelphos. Discovered gardening in a rear garden at Rookery Crescent

properties.title: Cupar, Bishopgate
properties.source: Roman coins found in Scotland, 1971-1982', Proc Soc Antiq Scot, vol. 113, 1983. Page(s): 412

properties.title: Turlin Moor
properties.description: A Greek bronze coin found Turlin Road

properties.title: Gallow's Hill, Dingwall
properties.source: PSAS 127 (1997), Roman Coins Found in Scotland 1988-95

properties.title: Runway between Prestwick & Ayr
properties.source: PSAS 127 (1997), Roman Coins Found in Scotland 1988-95

properties.title: Denton
properties.description: A copper alloy Roman Ptolemaic bronze minted in Egypt. Reverse: three possible eagles (tall birds with feathered legs) standing upright, advancing left. Small circular pit in centre of reverse.The coin has been cast and appears to be an antiquarian loss.

properties.title: Alford, Aberdeenshire
properties.source: PSAS 133 (2003), Roman Coins Found in Scotland 1996-2000

properties.title: Reculver
properties.description: Copper alloy coin of Ptolemy VIII. Struck at Paphos, Cyprus. BMC 6.found on foreshore by car park, west of Roman fort

properties.title: Kettering
properties.description: A copper-alloy AE29 coin of the Ancient Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt. 2 Eagles. Discovered gardening at 8 Spinney Lane

properties.title: Keswick
properties.description: Bronze Coin of Ptolemy VI (180-145BC). Minted in Paphos, on Cyprus. The Pi-Alpha reverse control mark leads this coin to be attributed to Paphos. Similarity to Kendal hoard noted. [NB. PHI-ALPHA is a control mark, not a mint mark. Coin is from series issued at Alexandria.]

properties.title: Kirby Muxloe
properties.description: Greek copper alloy coin of the Ptolemaic dynasty. The object is in fair condition, has a diameter of 21mm, is 3mm thick and weighs 5.58g. m/d find

properties.title: North Cave
properties.description: Copper AE 33mm of Ptolemy IV Philopater (221-205 BC)Mint of Alexandria, EgyptObv. -; Diademed head of Ptolemy rightRev. ?TO?EMAI?? BA?I?E??; Eagle standing left on thunderbolt; to left, cornucopiae; between legs, (?I?)SNG Copenhagen, Ptolemies (1977), pl. VIII, cf. 202. m/d find on farmland

properties.title: Brighton
properties.description: Possible replica? Ptolemaic coin? A very similar, possibly identical coin has been found by another member of the same club, Ray Wilson, near Itford, East Sussex: SUSS-FC42C5.Am sending link to Sam for assessment - bringing in coin on 11.5.12.

properties.title: Near Lewes
properties.description: A possible Ptolemaic coin -- Similar to one discovered by another finder from the same club and recorded as : SUSS-7D56B1 .To be shown to Sam and Philippa for assessment.According to finder, coin was discovered while detecting more than a decade ago where the Ouse used to meander between Lewes and Newhaven (Nr. Itford Farm).

properties.title: Bishop's
properties.description: A very corroded copper-alloy Ptolemaic coin depicting a Ptolemaic king on the obverse and a head of Lybia on the reverse; it was struck in Cyrene, the capital of Lybia, which the Ptolemies occasionally controlled; date: 3rd or 2nd century BC. Approximately 20 metres to the west of Festival Pier on the Southbank in Central London. The finder commented 'I found it with my metal detector in central London on the southbank foreshore in a layer of very black, very nasty silt that is full of WW2 material (coins, flak, bullet casings etc) that are all being eaten away rapidly (not the usual kindly clay and mud of the Thames that preserves).'

properties.title: Welham Green
properties.description: A copper-alloy coin of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt, dating to the period 305-30 BC.Diameter: 29.7mm; thickness: 3.7mm. Weight: 16.11g. m/d find in garden

properties.title: Minster-on-Sea
properties.description: Copper 'AE 42' of Ptolemy III Euergetes (246-221 BC), Head of Zeus Ammon right / PTO?EMAIOY BA?I?E??; Eagle standing left. BMC Greek, Ptolemies, p. 55, nos. 87-88.

properties.title: Wymeswold
properties.description: Greek copper alloy coin of Ptolemy VI, minted in Egypt circa 160BC. Reverse type Dual eagles representing Ptolemy and his brother. spotted on surface near a fossil.

properties.title: Selborne
properties.description: A copper-alloy coin of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt, possibly Ptolemy II (285-246 BC) or similar, dating to the c.3rd to 2nd centuries BC. Obverse depicting the diademed head of Zeus-Ammon right. Reverse type depicting an Eagle standing left on thunderbolt, wings open, within a dotted border(?). Mint of Alexandria. Cf. SNG Copenhagen 40: pl. VI, nos. 163-166 for similar examples.The coin has a D-shaped cross-section, being flat to the reverse and convex to the obverse. m/d find.

properties.title: Horndean
properties.description: A copper-alloy hemidrachm of Ptolemy VI Philometor, first sole reign, dating to the period c.180-170 BC. Obverse depicting the diademed head of Zeus-Ammon right. [???]?EMAI??-BA?I?E[??] reverse type depicting an Eagle standing left on thunderbolt, sceptre across shoulder, lotus flower in left field. Cypriot mint. As Svoronos 1396; SNG Copenhagen 293. m/d find

properties.title: Camblesforth
properties.description: A copper-alloy hemidrachm of Ptolemy VI Philometor dating to the period c.186 - 145 BC. Two eagles standing left, side-by-side on thunderbolt, cornucopia to left. Cypriot mint. m/d find

properties.title: Leatherhead
properties.description: A copper-alloy coin of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt, possibly a dichalkon (1/24 drachm) or diobol of Ptolemy II (Ptolemaios II Philadelphos), dating to 285-246 BC. Mint of Alexandria. A surface find made by a walker. Surface find in grassland near a river channel.

properties.title: Clapham
properties.description: Three phases of Roman occupation were found including buildings and a ditch with finds including pottery, tesserae and a coin.

properties.title: Talbot Estate, Strood
properties.source: The Rochester Naturalist, vol. 6, 1924, no.130, p.54.
properties.description: Found on allotment on Talbot Estate, Stroud

properties.title: Lacey Green
properties.description: A bronze coin (denomination B) of Antiochus IV dating to the period 169 to 168BC. There is considerable debate as to whether these were struck in Egypt or Syria. (coincides with Antiochus' invasion of Egypt).

properties.title: Saint-Brieuc
properties.description: In the locality of La Ville Ginglin were found many kilograms of eastern coins, and particularly of Alexandria and the Ptolemies
